description: From Middle English miscarien, equivalent to mis- +‎ carry.

verbs.description: miscarry (third-person singular simple present miscarries, present participle miscarrying, simple past and past participle miscarried)

entries.meaning: (obsolete) To have an unfortunate accident of some kind; to be killed, or come to harm. [14th–18th c.]
(now rare) To go astray; to do something wrong. [from 14th c.]
To have a miscarriage; to involuntarily abort a foetus. [from 16th c.]
To fail to achieve some purpose; to be unsuccessful, to go wrong (of a business, project etc.). [from 16th c.]
examples: And, vext to see Affairs miscarry,
Declar'd in Council, Death must marry  […]

entries.meaning: Of a letter etc.: to fail to reach its intended recipient. [from 16th c.]
